intro: Pachyanthus brachylobus, commonly known as the dwarf pachyanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
